text: But maybe my use case doesn't really benefit from the improvements - I seem to remember that it was mainly beneficial for sorted tables? Here I'm joining two unsorted tables, left table has 18.5m rows, right table has 0.6m rows. There are four timings per batch here as the right table is joined onto the left table four times, using a different column in the left table each time.
